intro: Diplostephium rosmarinifolium, commonly known as the rosemary fern, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and lanceolate, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. The leaves are often used in traditional herbal remedies due to their aromatic properties.
